name: Pantages Hotel Toronto Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little nervouse about booking this hotel, based on some of the negative reviews but the pictures looked wonderful and so we decided to try it for ourselves.
reviews.title: One great Night

likes.disliked: — Bar closed to early opened too late

reviews.text: Valet parking was a litte expensive but it was worth it when our car came to us already warmed up for the trip home - it was freezing outside.
reviews.title: Good hotel in the Heart of Toronto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was great, very friendly, quick. Room was really nice and all of the staff that we ran into - even in the elevator were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Don't go to the convenient store

reviews.text: The spa is superb! The jasmine tea was excellent as were the pedicures. Previous reviews complained about difficulty with changing appointments but I had to change a couple of times with no issues at all.
reviews.title: Loved the Spa and staff

likes.disliked: — Hotel front desl staff, not paying attention to the customer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing missing in our room was a second housecoat and the price list of in room treats. The beds were sooo comfortable we didn't want to get up the next day.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay

likes.disliked: — Larger bathroom would have been nice -- but that is a quibble.

reviews.text: My boyfriend booked us in at the Pantages the weekend of Feb 10th. We were meant to leave on the 12th and had to Niagara Falls. We were so pleased with the hotel and felt so cozy there that we decided to extend our stay for Valentine's Day. we felt so comfortble in our room it was almost like our own condo in T.O. It definetely has the WOW factor that our friend reccomended it would. The loby and Martini Bar is stunning, they have live Jazz on the weekend where we laid back on the sofa's and enjoyed while sipping their "signature martinis". The staff really take prode in the establishment and it shows. Great service. The rooms I cannot say enough about..... All amazing, from the beds to the decor. THUMBS WAY UP TO THE PANTAGES AND ALL THE STAFF.... YOU SHOULD KNOW THAT WE STAYED LONGER THEN WE WERE MEANT TO BECAUSE OF YOU! I can't wait to return. Too bad there are not any more Pantages around the world for others (not staying in T.O) to enjoy.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel!! 10/10

reviews.text: If you like hearing ambulance's and helicopters this is the place for you - conveniently located beside a hospital!
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival the front staff were clearly not in a good mood. When it was finally our turn to check in we were informed that the room we booked was not available. (reservations are useless here) So we had to stay in a smaller 1 bedroom. We had no other choice but to accept. The staff was extremly unapologetic and not helpful - they looked at us as if we were in the wrong. The lady at the desk said we would receive a discount for this inconvenience - in the end we never did.
reviews.title: Gorgeous, Modern, Luxurious

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and qulaity of the room and hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are alright, everything about the hotel is alright. I have stayed in plenty of hotels in Toronto and believe me there are way better ones for the same price/ amenities. The Spa is also nothing to rave about. Its hard to relax when you can here the helicopters landing at the hospital beside you. I found my service was very rushed and the staff were alright.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money unless you are looking for a great bed!!

reviews.text: All and all I didn't let this terrible hotel ruin my weekend. Toronto is a great city with so much to do. I just would advise any travellers to this city to avoid this hotel - there are tons of great hotels in Toronto other then the Pantages.
reviews.title: great ambience, great stay!
Nice Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed here for business for 3 nights.
Reservation via hotel web site: no problem.
reviews.title: Avoid this place ! Bad location - Spooky people nearby ! Unfriendly, Rude staff

likes.disliked: — AWFUL staff - refused to give out the names and refused to let us talk to manager

reviews.text: Check-in: was late (around 9pm) but desired type of room was waiting.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay!

likes.liked: — The staff always know the newest restaurants, and they can always get a reservations
likes.disliked: — why the rates keep going up. But I understand that they got a good thing, so why not charge more.

reviews.text: Room: nice; bed:good & comfortable; bathroom good; my room has kitchen (though didn't use much)
reviews.title: They cancelled my reservation the evening before my arrival

likes.liked: — can't say. They wouldn't give me the room I had reserved.
likes.disliked: — can't say. They wouldn't give me the room I had reserved.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet: for a fee (around $12), connection could have been better
reviews.title: Ignore the negative reviews-GREAT hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was impressed. The rooms were a exact replica of the picture online. The staff was great and helpful. The location was superb. I have yet to see a hotel that was perfect. Just because you had a bad day, doesn't mean that you should deter people from experiencing a quality establishment. I think they put a lot of thought and care into the design and operation of the hotel. The spa was great. I even saw a celeb there! Sometimes I waited on hold a while before I was able to speak with a spa employee but the treatment was so worth it. I highly recommend checking this place out.
reviews.title: People Should Stop Their Complaining

reviews.text: I've stayed at the hotel a few times now and it has always been ok. I usually don't bother looking for anywhere else to stay because of the location (practically the only thing that is going for this hotel). This was and will be the last time I stay at this hotel for good reason.
reviews.title: The bar says it all...

likes.disliked: — The bar! What a disaster, (If you don't know what you are doing, at least hire some good looking women)

reviews.text: 1. The doormen are usually very nice and helpful, but this last time I came for a later than usual check-in. The desk clerks were more than happy to assist me and were very friendly but you could just tell they didn't have the resources to help their guests. It appears the management decided that they would rather put their money in this ugly mesh netting that separates the bar from the entrance way than to hiring enough staff to accomodate this overly high-priced hotel.
reviews.title: Don't believe the hype

likes.disliked: — The filthy gym and room windows, alley-view in the closet gym

reviews.text: 2. The bar layout was ok before, but this time it looked like they hired some 10 year-old to move the furniture around... it looked like a garage sale. I could barely tell where the bar started and the hotel ended. As my title suggests this was the trend of things to come.
reviews.title: I had great time while visiting toronto
Hip and Sleek
reviews.text: 3. The room was medicore at best, clean and accomodating but on my way upstairs I ran into a older woman with a yappy dog who decided it was ok to bark at my briefcase.

description: In the heart of downtown Toronto, Pantages Hotel Toronto Centre offers style and luxury while pairing contemporary design with modern architecture and personalized service. This stylish boutique hotel includes a full service spa, exclusive meetings and events floor, martini bar & lounge with weekly live jazz. Our 90 well appointed suites are loaded with amenities that cater to short and long term stays and leave you wanting for nothing.
